t: Record-breaking warming and extreme drought in the Amazon rainforest during the course of El Niño 2015–2016 | Scientific Reports
s: The El Niño-Southern Oscillation (ENSO) is the main driver of interannual climate extremes in Amazonia and other tropical regions. The current 2015/2016 EN event was expected to be as strong as the EN of the century in 1997/98, with extreme heat and drought over most of Amazonian rainforests.
